html: 6.8.16  12:45 am   I'd really like to do this play that my area does every year, but the problem is that it takes up a lot of time: I have to be there from the end of school to almost 10:00 at night. It would be so fun to do it but it will take up a lot of time I need for homework and I'd most likely flunk a class or two. Do you think that doing it is worth it?

6.7.16  11:32 pm   Okay, so say someone claims they are always objective in their thinking meaning getting the end result of something, however, when they don't get it, they end up changing their mind, which is okay but they changed it because they don't want to admit they thought subjectively? Data, hard facts, and numbers are objective but wouldn't you agree when it comes to humans they are more subjective in their thinking of wanting an end result of something?
